newsitem.title: LATVIA: Olainfarm bounces back on Latvian bourse.
newsitem.headline: Olainfarm bounces back on Latvian bourse.

text.p: Latvian shares eased in sluggish trade on Monday with turbulent newcomer Olainfarm accounting for half of market volume as it bounced back once again.
"Summer is not the best time for the bourse, although the new companies, and some of the new ones which will be listed soon, should help increase interest," said one dealer.
Overall market volume was 80,000 lats and the Rietumu index fell 1.79 percent to 149.4.
Pharmaceutical producer Olainfarm remained volatile, jumping 14.8 percent to 2.40 lats in trade of 40,100 lats.
Dealers have been divided about the company's prospects and profitability since its bourse debut a week ago.
Hansa Investments, which brought the company to the market, says it is very profitable and maintains its poor first quarter results stemmed from accounting losses and tax liabilities.
A number of local dealers have been less generous in their assessment and claim that the stock, which has bounced up and down, is overpriced.
Confectionery producer Staburadze was the lone gainer on the official list, rising 0.4 percent to 2.70 lats in trade of 26,700 lats.
Trade was slow elsewhere on the market.
Two companies, Liepaja Oil and Riga Jewellery, were quoted for the first time, at 0.50 lats and 0.80 lats respectively. No shares were swapped in either firm.
Unibanka lost ground on the official list, falling 3.1 percent to 3.12 lats in trade of 3,700 lats.
